channel.title: Need help, can't decide for myself.
channel.description:
I need an unbiased opinion for each of these games, might sound weird that I mention no bias and I want you to list both pros and cons of them, by unbiased I mean don't try to make it better/worse than it really is. Funny that these have a quite good meta scores but I don't get a good vibe from reading negative user reviews, and I trust gamers more than journalists, so I really dunno now:
-Torchlight 2 (didn't like the first one much, managed to get to some weird spider boss and then i hit uninstall... the whole game is in dungeons, overpowered abilities and not a very user-friendly interface... prefer Diablo more) -Dishonored (not a big fan of stealth and looks like a worse Bioshock, also hate first person shooters with too much of RPG elements) -Far Cry 3 (same as above, also heard the AI sucks) -Hitman Absolution (can it be played actiony as well?) -Assassin's Creed 3 (yet to play a AC game) -Dark Souls -Resident Evil 6 -Bulletstorm -Deux Ex Human Revolution -Batman Arkham City -The Witcher 2 -DmC: Devil May Cry
Are any of these worth money and more importantly nerves that I lack nowadays? Thanks.

item.title: Need help, can't decide for myself.
item.dc:creator: Bloodshot
item.description:
I didn’t know FC3 had quicksaving and loading. I just used the “save” button in the menu that only seemed to work half the time.

Read full topic
item.source: Need help, can't decide for myself.

item.title: Need help, can't decide for myself.
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
Sometimes they’re too few and far between imo. It kinda pisses me off sometimes when I get really close to an objective only to die from some slip up. It’s weird, the game’s open nature encourages experimentation, but the checkpoint system discourages it.

Read full topic

During missions, you get checkpoints anyway.

item.title: Need help, can't decide for myself.
item.dc:creator: Dotard
item.description:
There’s undocumented quicksave/load options, like it’s not even mentioned in the controls scheme. F9/F11, but one can’t save during a mission at all, neither during animation and some scripted scenes, weirdly.

item.dc:creator: Dotard
item.description:
The only bad thing so far about FC3 is when there’s no checkpoint and after 30 minutes of playing a hunter and the hunted (tried to skin a damn cat but crocodiles ate me) the progress is lost ._.

item.source: Need help, can't decide for myself.

item.title: Need help, can't decide for myself.
item.dc:creator: _rot_fodder
item.description:
Maxey:

Seriously, FC3 fixed nearly every problem FC2 had and it’s awesome as shit.

Yeah, I got to say I was seriously impressed. Got it as a Christmas present cause I didn’t want to buy it after the far cry 2 debacle, so glad I got it though, it is tons of fun and has so many memorable, random moments.

I can also recommend Batman City and Deus Ex in that list, both are lots of fun. It is my steadfast opinion that it should be mandatory for every game in the world, from this point forward to have a remote control Battarang put into it.

Read full topic
item.source: Need help, can't decide for myself.

item.title: Need help, can't decide for myself.
item.dc:creator: Eric_Fong
item.description:
I am bit late on the thread but I have few thing that may helps in the future when you want to buy game.

First, you have to know what you actually want. Personally, I often go with game that have multiplayer and unlockables for more replayability

Second, what type of game is your favorites. I go with game that have sandbox style area like Fallout New Vegas or GTA

Third, what kind of theme you like. For me, I can pretty much accept all sort of theme, medieval, fantasy and modern

Read full topic
item.source: Need help, can't decide for myself.

item.title: Need help, can't decide for myself.
item.dc:creator: Dotard
item.description:
Didn’t like Dishonored, but bought Far Cry 3.
It’s not awesome at all… IT’S FU**ING DAMN AWESOME!!! Not only it plays well, it also looks damn great even on lower settings and the performance is unbelievable, one of the most well optimized PC games, if not the best.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help, can't decide for myself.
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
Bioshock didn’t set standards for shit. It MET a standard.

It was a decent spiritual successor to the System Shock franchise, which DID set standards.

We always argue about your opinions because they’re fucking stupid.

item.source: Need help, can't decide for myself.

item.title: Need help, can't decide for myself.
item.dc:creator: Dotard
item.description:
Bioshock set the standards for later games in the genre… I find lots of similarities in between the two, never said they were exactly the same, don’t take clone literary, most dungeon crawlers/action rpg are called “Diablo clones” even if they have butterflies and unicorns. I don’t see why do we have to argue about my opinion.

Read full topic
